H0.text: May 4, 1904 saw the US begin construction the Canal, following the creation of the state of Panama from Columbian territory due to the iron backbone and bad-assed support of which US president. Theodore Roosevelt

H1.text: May 4, 1904 saw the US begin construction the Canal, following the creation of the state of Panama from Columbian territory due to the iron backbone and bad-assed support of which US president. William McKinley

H2.text: May 4, 1904 saw the US begin construction the Canal, following the creation of the state of Panama from Columbian territory due to the iron backbone and bad-assed support of which US president. Grover Cleveland

H3.text: May 4, 1904 saw the US begin construction the Canal, following the creation of the state of Panama from Columbian territory due to the iron backbone and bad-assed support of which US president. T Ros

A4.text: Roosevelt persuaded Congress to approve the Panamanian alternative, and a treaty was approved, only to be rejected by the Colombian government.

A5.text: A treaty with the new Panama government for construction of the canal was reached in 1903.

A6.text: The commission decided in favour of Nicaragua, establishing this as the preferred route amongst American policy-makers.

A7.text: On 6 November 1903, Philippe Bunau-Varilla, as Panama's ambassador to the United States, signed the Hayâ€“Bunau-Varilla Treaty, granting rights to the United States to build and administer the Panama Canal Zone and its defenses.

A8.text: The United States first attempted to acquire control of a canal on the Panamanian isthmus via the Hay-Herran Treaty of 1903, but the treaty was not ratified.

A9.text: Roosevelt convinced US Congress to take on the abandoned works in 1902, while Colombia was in the midst of the Thousand Days' War.

A10.text: The Panama Canal was built by the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers between 1904 and 1914.

A11.text: In 1902, with the French efforts moribund, US president Theodore Roosevelt backed the Panama route, and Congress passed legislation authorizing him to purchase the French assets on the condition that an agreement was reached with Colombia.

A12.text: The Panamanians added a provision to their constitution at US request allowing the United States to intervene to preserve public order.
